content.description: This is the small right-facing dihedral in the center. Use slab, cracks, and the dihedral to reach the top. This climb is commonly soloed up and down. Belay with gear. Scramble up and right on the descent ledge to reach the couloir.
content.location: Start from a bit of flat ground just out of the wash.

climbs.name: Smith-Fuel
climbs.fa: George Smith, Mike Fuel- first known ascent

content.description: Climb slab and cracks in the broken left-facing corner. Its possible to stay in the corner all the way to the top and has been led but it gets looser, harder (5.9ish), more run-out, and more inviting to merge left. Scramble up and right on the descent ledge to reach the couloir.
content.protection: Cams- micro to 3", stoppers, brass nuts.
content.location: Start in the corner on the right side of the flat bit of land just out of the wash.

climbs.name: Luna Tick Fringe
climbs.fa: Dan Briely, Luna Harbour- first known ascent

content.description: Same slabby start as Gwynea Pig then take the wide cleft left up to the ledge. Belay with gear. Walk off right and down the couloir.
content.location: On the right side of the flat bit of land just out of the wash and next to the Death Couloir.

climbs.name: Gwynea Pig
climbs.fa: Dan Briley, Gwyn Miller, Brooke DeBoer, Luna Harbour- first known ascent

content.description: Take slabby moves in a low-angle corner, past a dark cleft, to easy ground then angle left, staying generally in the middle of he slab. Belay with gear. Walk off right and down the couloir.
content.location: On the right side of the flat bit of land just out of the wash and next to the Death Couloir.

content.description: Follow an easy low-angle crack to meet up with Waterfall Bypass Route. Belay with gear. Scramble up and right on the descent ledge to reach the couloir.
content.location: Start at the right edge of the wash to the right of the last overhang of First Waterfall Area.

content.description: Start at the edge of the wash, to the right of the last bit of steepness of the First Waterfall area, and climb right-leaning cracks over a bouldery bulge to a ledge. Belay with gear. Scramble up and right on the descent ledge to reach the couloir.
content.location: Begin in the wash to the right of the last overhang.

content.description: On the shoulder of the First Waterfall is a lower-angle area that has half a dozen routes with a bunch of variations. The small right-facing dihedral in the middle has been a go to work around to travel past the First Waterfall for ages. A rough ledge runs across the top of the wall, a little below the ridge, from the notch behind Quehoeâ€™s Tower south to the Death Couloir and provides nice third class access.
